feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: The daily wage calculator is a payroll feature that automatically calculates and deducts daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave. It determines the appropriate salary reduction by dividing the employee's total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month. The calculation accounts for public holidays by deducting them from the working days total. The feature supports both calendar days and working days leave policies. Upon approval of an unpaid leave request, an automatic pay deduction is created and reflected on the payroll table.

job_to_be_done.content: Calculate and deduct daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave by determining the appropriate salary reduction based on the number of working or calendar days in the month.

Provide a flexible and customizable method for calculating daily wages, including salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions, with options to select calculation bases and salary components.

Allow super admins to configure and customize leave encashment policies for end-of-service calculations by selecting salary components, choosing calculation methods, and defining eligible leave types.
To calculate and manage unpaid leave deductions on a daily basis for employee payroll, allowing these deductions to be set off against the employee's monthly pay.
Adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting their first salary and end-of-service settlement

primary_personas.content: HR personnel and payroll administrators responsible for managing employee leave and salary calculations.
Superadmin, Payroll table managers, and transaction processors who configure and manage daily wage calculations.
Super admins responsible for payroll and HR settings configuration.
Super Admins who configure leave policies and unpaid leave deduction calculations.
Super admin users who manage payroll configuration and salary proration settings

navigation_paths.content: Access the Daily Wage Calculator from Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation.
Access the Daily Wage Calculator via Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure.
Settings → Leaves → Leave Policies → Add policy → Unpaid leave selection.

prerequisites.content: An approved unpaid leave request must exist for the employee before daily pay deduction can be calculated and applied.
Company's public holiday calendar must be set up to exclude weekends and public holidays when using working days calculation base.
User must have super admin role to access and configure the Daily Wage Calculator settings.
Access to Leave Settings configuration as a Super Admin user.
Super admin access to payroll settings; active payroll system with employee records

data_inputs_required.content: Employee's total salary (basic salary plus allowance), number of working days in the month, number of calendar days (if using calendar days policy), public holidays falling in the month, and approved unpaid leave days.

Selection of calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days) and selection of salary components to factor into calculations (basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only).
Salary components selection (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), calculation method selection (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days), and eligible leave types for encashment configuration.
Selection of calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances) and day calculation type (calendar days, working days, or custom days) when configuring unpaid leave deduction settings.
Selection of calculation basis: custom days, calendar days, or working days

outputs_results.content: Automatic pay deduction reflected on the payroll table and calculated daily pay rate for unpaid leave deduction purposes.
Calculated daily wage rates that are applied to salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction calculations.
Customized leave encashment policy configuration that affects end-of-service calculations and visibility of which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten.
Configured unpaid leave deduction calculation settings that determine how daily deductions are applied to monthly employee pay.
Updated salary calculations that proportionally adjust employee compensation based on selected calculation method; changes applied to all active unpaid payroll amounts

procedures.content: Approve unpaid leave request, determine applicable leave policy (calendar days or working days), calculate total working days in the month, subtract public holidays from working days, calculate daily pay by dividing salary amount by actual working days, and generate automatic payroll deduction.

Navigate to Settings, select Payroll, choose Daily Wage Calculation, select the desired calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and choose which salary components to include in the calculation.

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure. 2. Select applicable salary components for leave encashments (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances). 3. Choose calculation method (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days). 4. Configure individual leave types for end-of-service calculations.

Navigate to Settings, select Leaves, go to Leave Policies, add a new policy, select the Unpaid leave option, choose a calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), and select a day calculation type (calendar days, working days, or custom days).

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation. 2. Select calculation basis (custom days, calendar days, or working days). 3. Save changes. 4. If payroll month is open with existing prorated transactions, reject those transactions and resave the new proration settings.

rules_limitations_constraints.content: Daily pay is calculated by dividing total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days. The leave policy determines whether calculation uses calendar days (e.g., 30 days) or working days (e.g., 22 days). Public holidays falling in the month must be deducted from working days to arrive at actual working days used in the calculation.

Calculation can be based on calendar days (actual days in the month), working days (excluding weekends and public holidays), or custom days (flexible basis set by payroll managers). Most UAE and KSA companies use 30 custom days to comply with labor law requirements.

Salary component options are limited to Basic Only or Basic + Allowances. Calculation method options include Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days. Super admins can configure specific leave types for end-of-service calculations.

Unpaid leave deductions must be calculated on a daily basis and set off against the employee's monthly pay. Multiple calculation method options are available (Basic Only, Basic + Allowances) and multiple day calculation types (calendar days, working days, custom days).

Changes to salary proration affect all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table. When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions are submitted, Super admin must reject existing transactions before saving new proration settings.

edge_cases_warnings.content: Public holidays must be carefully considered and subtracted from the working days total when calculating daily pay. For example, if 2 public holidays fall in a month with 22 working days, the daily pay calculation must use 20 days instead of 22 days.

Calculation varies depending on month length (e.g., 31 days in January, 28 days in February for calendar days). Different calculation methods can significantly impact final wage calculations, so selection of the appropriate calculation base is critical.
Super admins can see which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten by the new Daily Wage Calculator configuration.
Multiple options exist for daily rate calculation including Basic Only and Basic + Allowances, requiring careful selection based on organizational payroll policy requirements.

When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions exist for one or multiple employees, Super admin must manually reject those transactions before saving new salary proration configuration changes.

feature_interactions_dependencies.content: The daily wage calculator interacts with the payroll system to automatically create and reflect pay deductions, and connects with leave management systems for unpaid leave request processing and employee record systems for salary information.
The Daily Wage Calculator impacts three main areas: Salary proration, Leave encashment, and Unpaid leave deduction. It interacts with the company's public holiday calendar and payroll settings.
The Daily Wage Calculator interacts with Payroll settings, End of Service eligibility calculations, and Leave Management system to customize leave encashment policies.
Interacts with the payroll system by calculating daily deductions that are applied to monthly employee pay; similar to leave encashment functionality.
Interacts with Payroll system and affects active payroll table transactions; impacts first salary and end-of-service settlement calculations

glossary_terms.content: Daily pay: The calculated daily salary amount used to deduct unpaid leave days from an employee's salary, computed as total salary divided by actual working days in the month. ; Actual working days: The number of working days in a month after deducting public holidays from the total working days (e.g., 22 working days minus 2 public holidays equals 20 actual working days). ; Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee without pay, which triggers an automatic deduction from salary based on the daily pay calculation.

Calendar days: the number of days in a given month (e.g., 31 in January, 28 in February). Working days: only business days counted, excluding weekends and public holidays set on the company's public holiday calendar. Custom days: flexible calculation base set by payroll managers according to company policies.

Leave encashment: The process of converting unused paid leave into monetary compensation. End-of-service: The final settlement of employee benefits upon termination or separation. Daily Wage Calculator: A configuration tool for customizing leave encashment calculations based on salary components and calculation methods.

Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee that does not result in payment and requires deduction from monthly pay on a daily basis. Daily rate calculation: The method used to determine the daily deduction amount based on selected calculation method and day type.

DWC (Daily Wage Calculator): System component for configuring salary proration. Salary proration: Proportional adjustment of employee salary based on actual days worked. Calculation bases: Methods for determining prorated salary—custom days, calendar days, or working days.
